info.author: DataShop@CMU datashop-help@lists.andrew.cmu.edu
info.abstract: A learning curve visualizes changes in student performance over time. The line graph displays opportunities across the x-axis, and a measure of student performance along the y-axis. A good learning curve reveals improvement in student performance as opportunity count (i.e., practice with a given knowledge component) increases.
info.outputs: One or more image (.png) files, depicting the requested learning curve(s).
info.options:
Model: the Knowledge Component (KC) model to plot
Secondary model(s): one or more secondary KCs to include on graph
View secondary: flag indicating whether or not to display secondary model curves
Learning curve type:
Knowledge Components,
Students, or
All Student KCs
Standard deviation cut-off: The number of standard deviations above and below the mean for which to include data points.
Max opportunities: A maximum number of opportunities a student must have had with a KC for the student-KC pair to be included in the data.
Error bar type:
No Error Bars,
Standard Deviation, or
Standard Error
Learning curve metric:
Error Rate,
Assistance Score,
Number of Incorrects,
Number of Hints,
Step Duration,
Correct Step Duration, or
Error Step Duration
High-stakes CF name: this is the name of a custom field that indicates if a step is high-stakes.
